intro: Reseda gredensis, commonly known as the Gredens rockweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to harsh, alpine environments. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or white, and it produces small, elongated seed pods. Reseda gredensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens that mimic its natural habitat.
